headline: 5 tech stock picks for the second half of 2025: Dan Ives
summary: Wedbush Securities managing director and global head of technology research Dan Ives joins Market Domination to share his five stock picks in the tech sector (XLK): Nvidia (NVDA), Meta (META), Microsoft (MSFT), Palantir (PLTR), and Tesla (TSLA). Ives and Catalyst Funds co-founder, chief investment officer, and senior portfolio manager David Miller examine the pros and cons of owning tech names directly, compared to buying the S&P 500 (^GSPC) since the sector has such an oversized impact on the index. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Sutskever to lead Safe Superintelligence after Meta poaches CEO Gross in AI talent war
summary: (Reuters) -Ilya Sutskever has taken over the reins of Safe Superintelligence (SSI), the artificial intelligence startup he launched last year, after losing CEO Daniel Gross to an intensifying talent war in the industry.  Gross has joined Meta Platforms to lead its AI products division, sources told Reuters.  The development comes as tech giants such as Meta Platforms aggressively chase high-profile acquisitions and offer multi-million-dollar pay packages to attract top talent in the race to lead the next wave of artificial intelligence.

Gross has joined Meta Platforms to lead its AI products division, sources told Reuters.  The development comes as tech giants such as Meta Platforms aggressively chase high-profile acquisitions and offer multi-million-dollar pay packages to attract top talent in the race to lead the next wave of artificial intelligence.

headline: Why Meta Platforms Stock Jumped 14% in June
summary: Meta Platforms pushed further into artificial intelligence (AI) last month with a deal to take a 49% stake in Scale AI.  Shares of Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META) were moving higher again in June as the social media giant benefited from the broader uptrend in the stock market, and investors reacted to Meta's deal to take a 49% stake in Scale AI, a data-labeling start-up, for $14 billion.  Meta's ambitions in AI became clearer last month as the company made a splash with the Scale AI deal.

Meta's ambitions in AI became clearer last month as the company made a splash with the Scale AI deal.

headline: Meta, FedEx, Oracle: Trending Tickers
summary: Meta (META) was upgraded to Hold from Underperform by Needham analyst Laura Martin, citing higher employee productivity than Apple (AAPL) and Amazon (AMZN). FedEx (FDX) was upgraded to Outperform from Underperform by BNP Paribas after the company outperformed rival UPS (UPS) in volume and yield growth. Oracle (ORCL) is expanding its cloud deal with OpenAI (OPAI.PVT) by reportedly renting out 4.5 gigawatts of data-center power to the company, according to Bloomberg. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts here.

headline: Nvidia set to become world's most valuable company in history
summary: Shares of the leading designer of high-end AI chips were up 2.2% at $160.6 in morning trading, giving the company a higher market capitalization than Apple's record closing value of $3.915 trillion on December 26, 2024.  Nvidia's newest chips have made gains in training the largest artificial-intelligence models, fueling demand for products by the Santa Clara, California, company.  Microsoft is currently the second-most valuable company on Wall Street, with a market capitalization of $3.7 trillion as its shares rose 1.5% to $498.5.

raw.headline: Nvidia set to become world's most valuable company in history
raw.summary: Shares of the leading designer of high-end AI chips were up 2.2% at $160.6 in morning trading, giving the company a higher market capitalization than Apple's record closing value of $3.915 trillion on December 26, 2024.  Nvidia's newest chips have made gains in training the largest artificial-intelligence models, fueling demand for products by the Santa Clara, California, company.  Microsoft is currently the second-most valuable company on Wall Street, with a market capitalization of $3.7 trillion as its shares rose 1.5% to $498.5.

headline: The ‘Arbitrage Consultants’ Promising Risk-Free Sports Betting
summary: Stay-at-home mom  Jaylin Palacio  traveled to Arizona last year with a plan to sit in a hotel room and place thousands of dollars of bets on teams she knew nothing about.  The 54-year-old had stumbled into a corner of sports wagering known as “matched betting” via a recommendation in a Facebook mom group.  At her consultant’s instruction, she said she deposited $10,000 across Arizona’s legalized sportsbooks—more than she could wager in her home state of Nevada—and placed a series of bets.

raw.headline: The ‘Arbitrage Consultants’ Promising Risk-Free Sports Betting
raw.summary: Stay-at-home mom  Jaylin Palacio  traveled to Arizona last year with a plan to sit in a hotel room and place thousands of dollars of bets on teams she knew nothing about.  The 54-year-old had stumbled into a corner of sports wagering known as “matched betting” via a recommendation in a Facebook mom group.  At her consultant’s instruction, she said she deposited $10,000 across Arizona’s legalized sportsbooks—more than she could wager in her home state of Nevada—and placed a series of bets.

headline: "Magnificent Seven" Makeover: Which Stocks Have Earned a Spot, and Which Haven't?
summary: Palantir's revenue growth is accelerating, and its long-term opportunities appear to be huge.  Broadcom reports strong growth in its networking portfolio, and it has an even bigger opportunity in custom AI chips.  The so-called "Magnificent Seven" stocks -- Alphabet, Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL), Amazon, Meta Platforms, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) -- provided much of the driving force behind the market's strong growth over the past several years.

headline: Explainer-Will the EU delay enforcing its AI Act?
summary: STOCKHOLM (Reuters) -With less than a month to go before parts of the European Union's AI Act come into force, companies are calling for a pause in the provisions and getting support from some politicians.  Groups representing big U.S. tech companies such as Google owner Alphabet and Facebook owner Meta, and European companies such as Mistral and ASML have urged the European Commission to delay the AI Act by years.  The rules for general purpose AI (GPAI) models take effect on Aug. 2, a Commission spokesperson reiterated, adding that the powers for enforcing those rules start only on August 2 2026.

raw.headline: Explainer-Will the EU delay enforcing its AI Act?
raw.summary: STOCKHOLM (Reuters) -With less than a month to go before parts of the European Union's AI Act come into force, companies are calling for a pause in the provisions and getting support from some politicians.  Groups representing big U.S. tech companies such as Google owner Alphabet and Facebook owner Meta, and European companies such as Mistral and ASML have urged the European Commission to delay the AI Act by years.  The rules for general purpose AI (GPAI) models take effect on Aug. 2, a Commission spokesperson reiterated, adding that the powers for enforcing those rules start only on August 2 2026.
